The position of a car is determined at different times as the car moves horizontally to the right and recorded in the data table shown. Which of the following statements best describes the motion of the car based on this data?

choices.label: The average acceleration of the car is to the left because the ratio of the position to time decreases during the motion of the car.
The average acceleration is to the left because the average velocity during successive two second time intervals is decreasing.
The average acceleration is to the right because the average velocity of each <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> second time interval is positive.
The average acceleration is to the right because the position of the car is increasing.

content.answer: The average acceleration is to the left because the average velocity during successive two second time intervals is decreasing.
